item.description:
Meet in the parking lot at 11:00. Please consider carpooling.

Spring is here, time to smell the flowers! I here this palce is really nice. It has great views, gardens, greenhouses, a pond, and a cafe we can have lunch at. There is a one mile loop trail and some smaller trails, so I might add some extra walking outside of the garden after lunch.

Regular Admission
Adults, $10 . Seniors, $7
Youth 6-18, $5

Tower Hill Botanic Garden is a year-round, living 

museum displaying the finest plants for cultivation in 

central New England, with appeal to both the amateur and 

professional gardener, as well as the general public. 

Present features include the  Entry Garden  and Court

which give visitors an informative overview of the garden 

and its themes.

The  Stoddard Education & Visitors Center houses 

classrooms, a theater with an orientation video, a gallery, 

rest rooms, a drinking fountain, wheelchair loan and 

Twigs Café. Visitors will find books, tools, gifts, garden 

ornaments, live plants and film at  The Shop at Tower 

Hill. The 8,000 volume library also contains periodicals, 

nursery catalogs, and changing exhibits of horticulturally 

related art. 

An 18th-century style Orangerie, or cool greenhouse, 

features winter blooming, temperate and subtropical plants 

from October through May. 

Providing an educational experience in a beautiful setting, 

the Systematic Garden focuses on plant evolution and 

plant relationships.

The Wildlife Garden surrounds a vernal pond and contains 

feeding stations and shelter for birds and bats. Plants 

attractive to birds and butterflies are being added. A “Bird 

House” protects human wildlife/observers from mosquitos 

while displaying information about some of the birds one 

may see in this area.

V i s i t   the   Belvedere for a dramatic view of Mount 

Wachusett and the Wachusett Reservoir. Continue north 

along the trail to Tower Hill Summit, the highest point 

on the property. 

A one mile-long  Loop Trail  circles through managed 

natural areas including the Inner Park and Wildlife Refuge 

Pond. Intended as a naturalistic landscape, it displays a rich 

diversity of native species. Architectural features in the 

classical revival style, such as the whimsical Folly and The 

Moss Steps, provide  interesting destination points
item.name: Tower Hill Botanic Garden
